data.title: Undercover
data.description: When Jake discovers that a mobster escaped his otherwise successful sting, he enlists Charles to help track him down, which worries Gina.

data.title: Chocolate Milk
data.description: Holt's nemesis heads the precinct inspection, while Terry readies for his vasectomy and Charles needs a date for his ex-wife's engagement party.

data.title: The Jimmy Jab Games
data.description: When a motorcade detail is delayed, it leads to a wacky competition, and Charles must get an incriminating videotape from Hitchcock.

data.title: Halloween II
data.description: For their annual Halloween wager, Jake bets Holt that he can steal his watch before midnight, and Gina gets kicked off her dance squad, Floorgasm.

data.title: The Mole
data.description: Holt and Jake search for a mole in the precinct, and Terry and Rosa visit a silent disco to find "Giggle Pig" dealers.

data.title: Jake and Sophia
data.description: Jake is attracted to a woman he soon discovers is the attorney for a perp he's after, and Rosa gets Amy to run for union rep to replace Scully.

data.title: Lockdown
data.description: When the precinct goes into lockdown on Thanksgiving night, it's up to Jake to keep morale high, even as things spiral out of control.

data.title: USPIS
data.description: To catch a drug dealer, Jake and Charles must team up with an incompetent Postal Service investigator. Meanwhile, the team helps Amy quit smoking.

data.title: The Road Trip
data.description: When Jake and Amy have to stay overnight at a hotel for a case, Jake invites Sophia and Amy's boyfriend Teddy over, but the move backfires.

data.title: The Pontiac Bandit Returns
data.description: Jake and Rosa catch the Pontiac Bandit, who could lead them to the Giggle Pig kingpin. Charles and Gina worry about their parents getting close.

data.title: Stakeout
data.description: Jake and Charles go on a stakeout that lasts way too long, and Terry writes a book for his daughters that angers Amy and Gina.

data.title: Beach House
data.description: Jake ruins the precinct's annual beach house getaway when he's pressured into bringing Captain Holt. Gina wants to see "six-drink Amy."

data.title: Payback
data.description: Jake has to go to great lengths to keep a secret about Terry from the rest of the precinct, and Amy finally gets to partner up with Captain Holt.

data.title: The Defense Rests
data.description: When his relationship with Sophia gets in the way of her work, Jake tries to help, Wuntch needs Holt's help, and Charles wants Gina's blessing.

data.title: Windbreaker City
data.description: The Nine-Nine is invited to a terrorist training drill with Homeland Security, but the precinct's role as hostages doesn't go over so well.

data.title: The Wednesday Incident
data.description: Jake is determined to prove that he's not to blame for Holt's bad mood, and when Charles catches a notorious bank robber, nobody believes him.

data.title: Boyle-Linetti Wedding
data.description: It's wedding day for Charles and Gina's parents, and everyone in the squad is given duties; but Jake and Gina get distracted, and Terry has troubles.

data.title: Captain Peralta
data.description: When Jake's absentee father visits, Charles suspects he's up to no good. Holt throws down a brain twister challenge.

data.title: Sabotage
data.description: Holt makes Amy and Rosa investigate Jake's bad luck, but he also insults Gina. Charles partners with Hitchcock and Scully.

data.title: AC/DC
data.description: Terry forces Jake to take time off after he's injured chasing a perp, and Holt and Rosa go on an awkward double date with their significant others.

data.title: Det. Dave Majors
data.description: Jake gets jealous over another detective's romantic interest in Amy, and Terry is tempted to accept a job at a private security firm.

data.title: The Chopper
data.description: Holt worries Jake is being set up to fail when Wuntch green lights his dream assignment, and Terry hosts a field trip for a magnet school.

data.title: Johnny and Dora
data.description: Jake and Amy go undercover to catch an infamous identity thief, and the squad is rocked by an unexpected farewell.
